Description: Temptation of St Antony; the saint seated at centre, surrounded by women, some nude, one seated in the foreground, seen from behind, reaching towards him Oil
Curator's comments: For an introduction to the series of St Antony, see under no. 1907-7-17-42. Here the saint is literally surrounded by the human figures, as the woman in the foreground seen from behind closes the circle around the hermit, differently from all the other drawings of the series where St Antony is partially ringed or his tormentors are to the side. In this regard it is similar to 1907-7-17-13, which represents a 'Temptation' but it is not part of the present series. A similar combination of temptation and punishment can be seen in the drawings listed under no. 1907-7-17-50. One of the figures is crowned as in the drawings listed under no. 1907-7-17-42. 1907-7-17-1 to 90 is a so-called sketchbook, dismembered after its acquisition in 1907. A Title Page inscribed in brown ink is at the beginning of the series Lit.: H. Tietze and E. Tietze-Conrat, 'The Drawings of the Venetian Painters in the 15th and 16th Centuries', New York, 1944, no. 1526/61, p. 265
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Don Gaspar Mendez de Haro y Guzmán, Marchese del Carpio
Acquisition notes: 1907,0717.1 to 90 have been extracted from a XVIIc album with the title 'Disegni di Giacomo Tintoretto raccolti in Roma dall'Eccmo Sig. Don Gasparo d'Haro e Guzman, Marchese del Carpio .... e nel 1682 eletto Vice Re e Capitano Gnle del Regno di Napoli.' The album covers survive and are kept in the Stationary Cupboard.
